credits.title: Project Story
credits.storyP1: My Volley was developed with passion by Antonin Marcon, an independent developer based in South-West France. The app was initially created for a very personal need: helping his own volleyball team analyze their matches and improve (hence the project name!).
credits.storyP2: Today, the tool is open to all volleyball enthusiasts who want to track and analyze their performance with precision.
credits.supportDesc: My Volley is free and will remain so. If you enjoy the app, you can support its development with a small coffee!
credits.basketDesc: Complete scouting, match sheets and live team statistics.
credits.tennisDesc: Ultra-precise set-by-set tracking, match dynamics and bounce zones.
credits.padelDesc: 100% Padel scouting: Point mapping, faults and pair analysis.

help.title: Help center
help.scoringP1: Tap "+" below the scoring team's score, choose the action (attack, ace, opponent fault‚Ä¶), then tap on the court to place the point. Then select the relevant player.
help.scoringP2: The score updates automatically. Each action awards 1 point (except neutral events like reception).
help.heatmapP1: In the Statistics tab, the heatmap shows the impact zones for each team. Hot zones (red) indicate where the most points were scored.
help.heatmapP2: Filter by set and action type (attacks, faults, aces‚Ä¶) for ultra-precise tactical analysis. Export the heatmap as PNG for your training reports.
help.teamP1: Add your players with their jersey numbers in the Roster. Numbers significantly speed up live scouting ‚Äî instantly identify the player on the court.
help.teamP2: Players and their statistics are synced to the Cloud and reusable across matches.
help.volleyballScored: Points Won: Attack, Ace, Block, Tip, Second touch.
help.volleyballFaults: Opponent faults: Out, Net, Missed serve, Block Out, Gameplay fault, Opponent fault.
help.volleyballNote: The set ends manually with "End Set". Sides swap automatically.
help.exportDesc: Export your stats as PNG (screenshot), detailed Excel (XLSX) set by set, or share the match via a unique read-only link.

matchPage.helpVolleyP1: 1. Tap "+" below the score of the relevant team. An animated arrow indicates the selected team.
matchPage.helpVolleyP2: 2. Choose the tab: Points Won (Attack, Ace, Block, Tip, Second touch) or Opponent Faults (Out, Net, Missed serve, Block Out).
matchPage.helpVolleyP3: 3. Click the action then place it on the court (allowed zone lights up) and select the player.
matchPage.helpVolleyP4: 4. Manage sets: "End Set" finishes and swaps sides. The winner üèÜ = most sets won.
matchPage.helpVolleyP5: 5. Statistics: Stats tab to see points ‚ö° and faults ‚ùå per player (expandable) + heatmap.
matchPage.helpVolleyP6: 6. Export & Share: PNG stats, court per set, Excel, or share the score via WhatsApp / Telegram / X.

actionsDesc.attack: Successful attack landing in the opponent's court.
actionsDesc.ace: Direct serve that the opponent cannot return.
actionsDesc.block: Point scored at the net with a block.
actionsDesc.bidouille: Tip or deflection at the net that deceives the opponent.
actionsDesc.seconde_main: Point scored on the 2nd touch (attacking pass).
actionsDesc.other_offensive: Offensive action that doesn't fit any other category.
actionsDesc.out: Ball sent out of bounds by the opponent.
actionsDesc.net_fault: Opponent touches the net or sends the ball into the net.
actionsDesc.service_miss: Missed serve: ball doesn't clear the net or goes out.
actionsDesc.block_out: The block deflects the ball out of bounds.
actionsDesc.gameplay_fault: Includes net faults, penetration faults or line faults.
actionsDesc.opponent_fault: Any fault committed by the opponent without a specific action.
actionsDesc.other_volley_fault: Fault that doesn't fit any other category.
actionsDesc.timeout: Timeout called by one of the teams.
